H0.text: Which Palestinian co-founded al Fatah in 1957. Yasser Arafat

H1.text: Which Palestinian co-founded al Fatah in 1957. Khalil al-Wazir

H2.text: Which Palestinian co-founded al Fatah in 1957. Salah Khalaf

H3.text: Which Palestinian co-founded al Fatah in 1957. Abu Amar

A4.text: In the latter part of the 1950s, Arafat co-founded Fatah, a paramilitary organization which sought Israel's replacement with a Palestinian state.

A5.text: In 1957, Arafat encountered Salah Khalaf ('Abu Iyad') and Khalil al-Wazir ('Abu Jihad') in Kuwait, who were both official members of the Egyptian Muslim Brotherhood.

A6.text: Salah Khalaf, along with Arafat, Farouk al-Qaddum, Khaled al-Hassan, Abd al-Muhsin al-Qatan, and Khalil Ibrahim al-Wazir, founded Fatah in Kuwait.

A7.text: Khalil Ibrahim al-Wazir was among the founders of Fatah alongside Arafat and others.
